SECTION-1.Line1: Welcome to NRCAN DataHub - we hope your experience is a great one!
SECTION-1.Line2: If you need anything at all, please do not hesitate to reach out to us.  Your feedback drives our development of new features and allows us to squash any annoying little bugs that you may find along the way.  So please do not hesitate to send us an email to our support mailbox.  We promise we will read and respond to everyone!
SECTION-1.Title: Thanks for giving us a try

SECTION-2.Line1: As a part of the Limited Release Team, we are giving you early access to our Alpha release.  We hope that you will take the time to use the platform as much as possible to become familiar with its features.  This will enable us to get some insight into what works and what does not.
SECTION-2.Line2: Over the next few weeks, we will be putting the platform through the ringer by 'simulating' a few real-world scenarios while you continue to use the platform.  These simulations will include things like service failure and recovery, hundreds of simultaneous users, and other exciting tests.  We hope that you will not notice any of these activities but, if you do, please grab a screenshot or shoot us an email to tell us about your experience.  We would very much appreciate some insight into what worked and what did not.  We may also ask you for feedback in the form of a short survey or group discussion.  This will help us to further narrow down any issues that may arise.
SECTION-2.Line3: Thank you again for participating and we look forward to speaking with you in the near future!
SECTION-2.Title: What can you expect?

SECTION-3.Line1: This is your own personal storage space!  It is intended for your use and enjoyment.
SECTION-3.Line2: Please feel free to upload and share files with your colleagues on the Limited Release Team or the Developers.  You have 100GB of storage space that you can use in whatever way you like.  We encourage you to try uploading, sharing and searching for files of various types.  There may even be some Easter Eggs (datasets) so keep an eye out for those.
SECTION-3.Line3: Enjoy and let us know if you have any questions!
SECTION-3.Title: Securely store all of your data

APPROVAL-FORM.Dataset_Title_TXT: Title of Dataset(s) or Information Resource(s)
APPROVAL-FORM.Copyright_Restrictions_FLAG: There are no known legal, licensing, or copyright restrictions to prevent the data or information from being released by the department or agency under the terms of the Open Government Licence – Canada.
APPROVAL-FORM.Authority_To_Release_FLAG: The department or agency has the departmental mandate, legislative authority or permission from a third party provider to publish the data or information resource under the Open Government Licence – Canada.
APPROVAL-FORM.Private_Personal_Information_FLAG: The data or information resource does not contain any personal information as defined in section 3 of the Privacy Act, R.S.C. 1985, c. P-21 as confirmed by the ATIP Secretariat.
APPROVAL-FORM.Subject_To_Exceptions_Or_Eclusions_FLAG: The data or information resource is not subject to any exemptions or exclusions under Section 13 “Exemptions” or Section 68 “Exclusions” of the Access to Information Act, R.S.C 1985 as confirmed by the ATIP Secretariat.
APPROVAL-FORM.Not_Clasified_Or_Protected_FLAG: The data or information resource is not Classified or Protected and its release complies with the Government of Canada Policy on Government Security.
APPROVAL-FORM.Can_Be_Released_For_Free_FLAG: The data or information resource can be released to the public without fee.
APPROVAL-FORM.Machine_Readable_FLAG: A) Datasets are provided in machine-readable / machine-processable format.
APPROVAL-FORM.Non_Propietary_Format_FLAG: B) Information resources are provided in open, non-proprietary formats.
APPROVAL-FORM.Localized_Metadata_FLAG: Metadata in both official languages conforming to the applicable Government of Canada metadata standard is provided for each dataset or information resource.
APPROVAL-FORM.Updated_On_Going_Basis_FLAG: Existing dataset will be updated on an on-going basis.
APPROVAL-FORM.Collection_Of_Datasets_FLAG: Represents a collection of datasets or data products with a consistently applied specification or model.
APPROVAL-FORM.Approval_InSitu_FLAG: Represents a series of observation data, such as data collected from in-situ sensors.

STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.Title: Storage Cost Estimator
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara1: This tool can be used to estimate the initial migration cost as well as the monthly cost in CAD$ for an Azure storage solution using the Block Blob v2 service.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara2: Proceed by entering the parameters in this form to the best of your knowledge and the cost estimate will be calculated and displayed below. You can then send yourself a copy of the estimate by email.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara3: Before using this tool, please read and accept the following statement:
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.PriceListLastUpdated: This estimate is based on Azure storage prices for the Canada Central region, last fetched on {0}.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.EstimateDisclaimer: I understand that this tool provides an estimate of the cost based on the specified parameters, and the actual cost may vary based on real-world usage factors such as the actual amount of data, access patterns, etc.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.MoreInfoIntro: For more information, please expand the following sections:
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.MicrosoftDocNote: These definitions are based on Microsoft Azure documentation. For more details, please consult the official Microsoft website.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.HotTierExplanation: The Hot tier is optimized for storing data that is accessed or modified frequently. It has the highest storage costs, but the lowest access costs.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.CoolTierExplanation: The Cool tier is optimized for storing data that is infrequently accessed or modified, that should be stored for a minimum of 30 days. It has lower storage costs and higher access costs compared to the Hot tier.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.ArchiveTierExplanation: Archive is an 'offline' tier optimized for storage of data that is rarely accessed, with flexible latency requirements on the order of hours. Data in the Archive tier should be stored for a minimum of 180 days.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.LRSExplanation: Locally redundant storage (LRS) copies your data synchronously three times within a single physical location in the primary region. LRS is the least expensive replication option, but is not recommended for applications requiring high availability or durability.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.ZRSExplanation: Zone-redundant storage (ZRS) copies your data synchronously across three Azure availability zones in the primary region. For applications requiring high availability, Microsoft recommends using ZRS in the primary region, and also replicating to a secondary region.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.GRSExplanation: Geo-redundant storage (GRS) copies your data synchronously three times within a single physical location in the primary region using LRS. It then copies your data asynchronously to a single physical location in the secondary region. Within the secondary region, your data is copied synchronously three times using LRS.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.NoArchiveZRSNote: Note: The Archive tier is not supported with ZRS redundancy.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.EstimateEmailIntro: Here is the storage cost estimate for the first year, using the specified parameters. Please note that this is only an estimate, and actual cost may vary due to factors including amount of data and usage patterns.
STORAGE-COST-ESTIMATOR.EstimateEmailAdminIntro: User {0}({1}) has generated this Azure storage cost estimate:

COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.Title: Compute Cost Estimator
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara1: This tool can be used to give a rough estimate of Databricks compute cost in CAD$ for a given workload.
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara2: Proceed by entering the parameters in this form, and the cost estimate will be calculated and displayed below. You can then send yourself a copy of the estimate by email.
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.IntroPara3: Before using this tool, please read and accept the following statement:
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.PriceListLastUpdated: This estimate is based on Azure Databricks and compute prices for the Canada Central region, last fetched on {0}.
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.EstimateDisclaimer: I understand that this tool provides an estimate of the cost based on the specified parameters, and the actual cost may vary based on real-world usage factors.
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.MoreInfoIntro: For more information, please expand the following sections:
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.WorkloadTypesP1: This tool uses a set of workloads designed to represent a broad range of usage scenarios. The workloads use these machine specs:
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.WorkloadTypesP2: Each workload uses several instances of these machines:
COMPUTE-COST-ESTIMATOR.CostsP1: Each workload is billed based on the virtual machines provisioned for the task, as well as the Databricks Units (DBUs) used.

UserEmail.EstimateEmailIntro: Here is your Databricks compute cost estimate, using the specified parameters. Please note that this is only an estimate, and actual cost may vary due to real-world usage and workload factors.

AdminEmail.EstimateEmailAdminIntro: User {0}({1}) has generated this Databricks compute cost estimate:

Number of users in the workspace: Number of users in the workspace
You can create a new workspace to start: You can create a new workspace to start working on your project
Featured workspaces are a selection of w: Featured workspaces are a selection of workspaces that are currently being promoted by the Datahub team. You can view these projects' shared content to see what they are working on.
Welcome to the Federal Science Datahub r: Welcome to the Federal Science Datahub resources and documentation section. Below you will find a short list of some recommended resources to help you get started with the Datahub. If you are looking for something specific, you can also browse the full list of resources on the navigation sidebar.
Below you will find a comprehensive list: Below you will find a comprehensive list of the most popular resources on the Datahub. If you are looking for something specific, you can also browse the full list of resources on the navigation sidebar.
Please complete the following informatio: Please complete the following information to create a new workspace
(Optional) Which features are of interes: (Optional) Which features are of interest to you?
Copy the emails of all users in the curr: Copy the emails of all users in the current environment. Excludes gmail, ssc-spc and apption emails.
Copy the emails of locked users in the t: Copy the emails of locked users in the tenant.
Resource request has been successfully s: Resource request has been successfully submitted
Resource request has failed, please cont: Resource request has failed, please contact an administrator
Welcome to the Government of Canada\u002: Welcome to the Government of Canada's digital hub for science data solutions.
Register here to escape the silos. On th: Register here to escape the silos. On the Federal Science DataHub you can:
Access fit-for-purpose, scalable storage: Access fit-for-purpose, scalable storage for GC science Data
Easily share your data with your GC coll: Easily share your data with your GC colleagues
Perform analytics and collaborate with y: Perform analytics and collaborate with your GC science partners in an interactive environment
Choose whether or not to display alert a: Choose whether or not to display alert and tutorial dialogs in Datahub.
Access the Databricks notebooks for the: Access the Databricks notebooks for the workspace to write, execute and share analytics with all workspace members
Access the storage accounts for the work: Access the storage accounts for the workspace to upload, download and share datasets with all workspace members.
What is the Federal Science DataHub?: What is the Federal Science DataHub?
The Federal Science DataHub is a secure,: The Federal Science DataHub is a secure, cloud-based platform that provides a collaborative environment for GC scientists and researchers to store, work with, and share data.It is a central location for GC scientists and researchers to store data, perform collaborative analysis, and manipulate data using advanced analytics tools.
If you\u0027re just getting started, we: If you're just getting started, we recommend reading this short introduction, which will guide you through the layout and basic functionalities of the Federal Science Datahub.
If you would like to learn more, you can: If you would like to learn more, you can also visit the
The Federal Science Datahub website is d: The Federal Science Datahub website is divided into 3 parts:
: Accessing the home page, the news page: : Accessing the home page, the news page, exploring and searching for workspaces or users.
: Accessing your workspaces, your recent: : Accessing your workspaces, your recent resources or your profile.
: Where science is done! Wherever you go: : Where science is done! Wherever you go, this section will display the page's main content, and in the case of the home page, you will see your personal dashboard, where your profile, achievements and workspaces are displayed.
The next few pages will show you how to: The next few pages will show you how to use this layout and create your very own workspace!
The topbar contains the major navigation: The topbar contains the major navigation routes:
: A dashboard of your workspaces and res: : A dashboard of your workspaces and resources.
: Where you can find information pertain: : Where you can find information pertaining to new features of the FSDH as well as potential service disruptions.
: Find what your peers are doing by brow: : Find what your peers are doing by browsing featured workspaces.
: Read guides and tutorials on how to us: : Read guides and tutorials on how to use our platform and its many tools.
: You can also search for workspaces, re: : You can also search for workspaces, resources or users on the platform using the search box in the topbar.
: You can request for support using the: : You can request for support using the help button, or access your profile settings.
: Where you can find the workspaces you: : Where you can find the workspaces you are a part of, as well as the button to create a new workspace. As you are just getting started, we recommend you create a workpace!
: Where you can find a list of the recen: : Where you can find a list of the recent resources you have accessed. From there, you can quickly multitask by jumping back and forth between different resources.
: Where you can find your profile settin: : Where you can find your profile settings, ranging from appearance and customization to your notification settings!
Clicking the \u0022New\u0022 button in t: Clicking the "New" button in the workspace section of the sidebar will open a pop-up which will guide you in the creation of your very own workspace! Once you are done selecting a name, an acronym will be auto-generated for you, but you may change it!
Happy with your workspace name and acron: Happy with your workspace name and acronym? Click on "Create workspace" and your new workspace will soon appear in the sidebar!
A workspace in the Federal Science Datah:
A workspace in the Federal Science Datahub is a collection of cloud resources along with a list of members. The cloud resources within your workspace (e.g. storage accounts, etc.) are only accessible by the members of your workspace and
can
only be managed by workspace admins or leads.
A FSDH workspace is the perfect place to:
A FSDH workspace is the perfect place to collaborate with GC colleagues, share data and analytics, and build research or
business projects.
There are two important sections of the: There are two important sections of the page when working within a workspace:
: This is where you can navigate to the: : This is where you can navigate to the different tools in your workspace, as well as manage the workspace itself. As we are just getting started, there may not be any available tools in your brand new workspace but we will get there!
: This is where your selected tool will: : This is where your selected tool will be displayed and where you will do your work! In the picture above, the workspace dashboard is displayed, where you can see an overview of your workspace, its tools, its members and its incurred costs.
The first section of our workspace sideb:
The first section of our workspace sidebar displays the different tools that are built within our workspace. A new workspace will only have the dashboard available, but as your project grows, you will have several tools available to you,
such as Databricks, file storage, databases, web applications and more!
The second section of the sidebar is whe: The second section of the sidebar is where you manage your workspace:
: Request new tools for your workspace.
: Manage workspace users and their roles: : Manage workspace users and their roles and permissions.
: Provide additional information regardi: : Provide additional information regarding your workspace.
: Access costing and storage information: : Access costing and storage information of your workspace.
: Define other settings pertaining to yo: : Define other settings pertaining to your workspace.
: The first step of a new workspace is a: : The first step of a new workspace is always to fill out the metadata! Without having filled your workspace metadata you _cannot_ request new tools from the toolbox. Let us have a look at metadata!
The first step towards success: metadata: The first step towards success: metadata
Entering the metadata of your workspace: Entering the metadata of your workspace
In order to do anything in your workspac:
In order to do anything in your workspace, it is required that you fill out your project metadata. Metadata is information about the project, such as a description, keywords and organization, that allow us to have a better idea
of your needs and that will allow peers outside of your workspace to get an idea of what you're doing!
Make sure you fill out all of the requir:
Make sure you fill out all of the required information and that you click "Save Metadata" at the bottom! You are asked to provide information in both official languages for some of the fields, but you can use the "Google translate" button to
automatically populate the missing language.
Inviting your colleagues to your workspa: Inviting your colleagues to your workspace
Once you have filled your metadata, it i:
Once you have filled your metadata, it is a great time to start inviting your colleagues. To do so, navigate to the "Users" tab of your workspace from the sidebar, where you will see all of the current members of your workspace
and their roles. Then click "Invite new user", enter their email and select "Add new user" (if they are not already part of FSDH) or their FSDH account (if they are existing users). Once you have selected all the users you want to add
click the "Add new users" button in purple, then select the roles of the members you are going to invite!
is the default role and has only read a: is the default role and has only read access to all resources within your project.
is the role that you will want to give: is the role that you will want to give to most of your colleagues. It gives them read/write access to most of your resources.
users have read/write access to your re: users have read/write access to your resources and can also manage other peoples permissions as well as your workspace tools.
should be given to as little people as: should be given to as little people as possible. They have all permissions on the workspace and are also the business representative for the workspace for potential communications and issues.
Once you have decided a role for all you: Once you have decided a role for all your colleagues, ensure that you click the "Save Changes" button, which will send all the required invitations.
Note that workspace leads and admins can: Note that workspace leads and admins can remove members by selecting their role and selecting "Remove User".
Requesting a tool in the toolbox: Requesting a tool in the toolbox
Once your metadata is complete and you h: Once your metadata is complete and you have invited your colleagues in your workspace, the final step is to request the tools necessary to your project!
To do so, navigate to the toolbox, where: To do so, navigate to the toolbox, where you will see all of the tools currently available in FSDH, ensure you read and understand the description of each tool and request the ones you need simply by clicking the "Add to workspace" button!
Once you add a tool to your workspace, i: Once you add a tool to your workspace, it may take up to 30 minutes before it appears in your sidebar, at which point you will be able to use it by simply clicking on it. If you have any issues or concerns regarding requesting tools, feel free to contact us.
No cost data available, please check bac: No cost data available, please check back later
Here you can manage your workspace datab: Here you can manage your workspace database. You can view and test the connectivity of your database
Share a file using the workspace Storage: Share a file using the workspace Storage Explorer
How do I turn this thing on: How do I turn this thing on

You are an administrator and can view al: You are an administrator and can view all the repositories linked to your instance of Databricks. Collaborators can only view their own linked repositories.
You are not an administrator and you can: You are not an administrator and you can only see the repositories linked to your own account in Databricks. If you wish to share other repositories, request a workspace administrator to share them.

Need a hand? We've got you covered.
Our Resources page has many resources th: Our Resources page has many resources that could be helpful for you. Additional support is available using the FSDH Support Request Form.
To report an issue or request assistance: To report an issue or request assistance, please use the FSDH Support Request Form.
What are you having trouble with? (Pleas: What are you having trouble with? (Please select all that apply)
Please provide additional information th: Please provide additional information that we can use to investigate this issue.
Please indicate which workspaces you hav: Please indicate which workspaces you have this issue in. (Please select all that apply)
Please indicate which language you would: Please indicate which language you would like to be contacted in.
Your support ticket has been created. Th: Your support ticket has been created. Thank you!
Please confirm the following. If you see: Please confirm the following. If you see any errors, use the Previous button to change them. Otherwise, click Submit to submit your ticket.
If you believe this is an error, please: If you believe this is an error, please fill out a Support Request Form and we'll get right on it.
Otherwise, you can click the button belo: Otherwise, you can click the button below to return to the main page of DataHub.

Welcome to the Government of Canada's ne: Welcome to the Government of Canada's new one-stop hub for science data solutions.
<b>Onboard here to escape the silos.</b>: Onboard here to escape the silos. With one simple sign-on, you can:
Access fit-for-purpose, scalable <b>stor: Easily share your data with your GC colleagues
Easily <b>share</b> your data with your: Easily share your data with your GC colleagues
Perform <b>analytics</b> and <b>collabor: Perform analytics and collaborate with your GC science partners in an interactive environment

RemoveStorageNamePrompt: Are you sure you want to remove cloud storage account {0} from this workspace? To restore it, you will need to add and configure its settings again.
UnclassifiedDataConfirmation: By checking this box, I affirm that any data contained in this storage account is unclassified.

OPENDATA-WIZARD.CancelSharingDescription: You can cancel this request to share the data file before it is approved.  The request to share will be deleted from system; however, the data file will remain stored in DataHub and may be shared in the future. Once approved, you will not be able to cancel the request.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.CancelSharingPrompt: Do you want to cancel this sharing request? To share this file in the future, the process will have to be restarted from the beginning.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.UnpublishOpenDataSharingPrompt: Do you want to cancel this file sharing on Open Data?
OPENDATA-WIZARD.Approval_filled_out: - Approval form has been filled out, now you can generate the approval form document.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.GeneratePDF_explanation: - Once you generate the approval form, please upload it to GCdocs and paste the URL of this file in the section below.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.Publish_As_URL_Desc1: Publish a URL to Open Data. The File is stored in DataHub.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.Publish_As_URL_Desc2: Note: The URL link will be broken if the File is deleted from DataHub.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.Upload_And_Publish_Desc: Publish an uploaded File to Open Data. A copy of the File is stored in DataHub.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.Uploading_file_in_progress: Uploading file in progress. You can wait or come back later if the file is too big. The upload is running in the background.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.Approval_Filled_out_1: Once the Open Government Approval Form is completed, generate the approval form.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.Approval_Filled_out_2: Save the generated approval form to GCdocs.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.Approval_Filled_out_3: Paste the GCdocs file link (https://gcdocs.gc.ca/nrcan-rncan/llisapi.dll/link/XXXXXXXX) in the section below.
OPENDATA-WIZARD.MustAcknowledgeMandatoryReleaseCriteria: You must acknowledge and check all Mandatory Release Criteria boxes before submitting.

PUBLIC-URL-WIZARD.CancelSharingDescription: You may cancel the sharing request at any time before approval. This will completely remove the sharing request from the system. However, the file will still remain in storage and may be shared in the future.
PUBLIC-URL-WIZARD.CancelSharingPrompt: Do you want to cancel this sharing request? To share this file in the future, the process will have to be restarted from the beginning.
PUBLIC-URL-WIZARD.DeleteExpiredDescription: This file is no longer publicly available, and the public sharing record may be deleted. The file itself will stay in storage.
PUBLIC-URL-WIZARD.DeleteExpiredPrompt: Delete the sharing request? After it's deleted, the file can be shared again by starting a new sharing request.
PUBLIC-URL-WIZARD.TempSharingDesc: You may optionally specify an expiration date, after which your file will no longer be publicly available.

ValidationErrors.ExpiryDateInPast: Expiration date cannot be in the past.
ValidationErrors.TempWithNoExpiry: Expiration date must be specified when temporary sharing is enabled.

REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.Title: Power BI Request Confirmation
REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.ErrorApproving: An error occurred while trying to approve the Power BI request.
REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.WorkspaceNameConflict: One or more of the following workspaces is missing a field or conflicts with an existing Power BI workspace:
REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.WorkspaceNameConflictInstruction: Please update the parameters or use the Power BI management interface in the Admin section to address any conflicts.
REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.WorkspacesToBeCreated: The following workspaces will be created and/or registered, and Power BI features will be enabled for this project:
REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.WorkspacesCreated: The Power BI service has been enabled and the following workspaces have been created:
REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.UsersToBeAdded: These workspace users will be added to the workspaces:
REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.PowerBiAlreadyEnabled: this project already has Power BI enabled. No further action is needed.
REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.NoPowerBiRequest: this project has no open Power BI request at this time.
REQUEST_APPROVAL_PAGE.NoPowerBiPermission: Your account doesn't have permissions to create Power BI workspaces.

POWER_BI_ADMIN.Title: Power BI Administration
POWER_BI_ADMIN.UnassignedWarning: Warning: This item's workspace is not linked to a Data Project.
POWER_BI_ADMIN.ChangesExist: There are workspaces, reports and/or datasets available in Power BI which are out of sync with the DataHub database. Expand the section below for more details.
POWER_BI_ADMIN.InstructionsP1: In this section, you can associate Power BI workspaces with Data Projects, and enter metadata for workspaces, reports and datasets in order to add them to the catalog. Workspaces can also be marked as "Sandbox" to indicate that they should not be included by default in search results.
POWER_BI_ADMIN.InstructionsP2: Assigning a workspace to a Data Project allows users of that Data Project to quickly and easily find the workspace and reports within it. Workspaces should be assigned to a Data Project before entering any metadata for the workspace or any reports within it, to allow the system to automatically populate some metadata fields if the information is available.
POWER_BI_ADMIN.InstructionsAdmin: In this Administration view, you have access to Power BI workspaces across all Data Projects in DataHub.
